cinnamon.engine.system

Class DebugCtrl

  • java.lang.Object
    • cinnamon.engine.system.DebugCtrl

  • public final class DebugCtrl
extends Object

    Provides query and control to many services and functions such as creating GameObjectManager.GObjects and checking the current framerate. Two kinds of commands are acted upon: query and action. Query commands begin with the word getGObject and prints requested information to the console. On the other hand, action commands have no specific identifier. These commands perform operations such as destroying GameObjectManager.GObjects but will still print an acknowledgment of the action to the console.

    For both query and action commands, if nothing is printed on the console in response to a command, the command was likely not recognized and may have been mistyped.

    The following query commands are supported: shutdown, getGObject ups, getGObject fps, getGObject meta, getGObject gl, getGObject gpu, getGObject processors, getGObject memory, getGObject resolution, getGObject obj configs, getGObject obj count, getGObject selected, getGObject room, getGObject view.

    The following action commands are supported: create obj <config name>, destroy selected, constrain view <true | false>.

    • Method Detail

      • debug

        public void debug()

        Polls the console for input. When it's received, assuming a well-formed command, the input is translated to either a query or action where the former prints to the console requested information and the latter executes specific operations such as creating a GObject.

      • stop

        public void stop()

        Requests the console cease taking input. This method only alerts the console to stop as soon as it can. However, if the console is already waiting on user input when this method is called, the console may not stop right away but first wait on the last input.
